response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9‑inch round cake pans, then line the bottoms with parchment paper. In a large bowl whisk together 2 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, 2 ½ teaspoons baking powder, ½ teaspoon baking soda, and ½ teaspoon salt to ensure even distribution and proper rise.",
  "step2": "In another bowl, combine 1 ¾ cups granulated sugar, ¾ cup brown sugar, and ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder. Add 1 cup melted butter, 4 large eggs, and 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Beat until smooth, then gradually stir in the dry mixture until just incorporated for a rich chocolate texture and moist.",
  "step3": "Fold in 1 cup chocolate chips and ½ cup chopped walnuts, if desired, distributing evenly. Divide batter between the prepared pans, smoothing tops with a spatula. Tap pans lightly on the counter to release air bubbles. Place pans on a baking sheet for stability during baking to ensure even rise and perfect texture result.",
  "step4": "Bake in the preheated oven for 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs. Rotate pans halfway through baking for even browning. Remove from oven and let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack carefully.",
  "step5": "Prepare frosting by melting ½ cup butter, then whisking in 1 ½ cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, and 2 tablespoons heavy cream. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, whisk until smooth and glossy. Adjust consistency with extra cream or sugar as needed, achieving a spreadable yet firm texture for perfect.",
  "step6": "Once cakes are completely cooled, spread a generous layer of chocolate frosting on the first layer, then place the second layer on top. Frost the top and sides evenly, creating a smooth finish. Garnish with additional chocolate shavings or walnuts, slice, serve, and enjoy with a glass of milk together."
}
